Types

NimObjKind {...}{.pure.} = enum
  NIMOBJECT_VOID, NIMOBJECT_BOOLEAN, NIMOBJECT_NUMBER, NIMOBJECT_STRING,
  NIMOBJECT_ARRAY, NIMOBJECT_OBJECT, NIMOBJECT_TYPE
NimObj = object
  case kind*: NimObjKind
  of NIMOBJECT_BOOLEAN:
      boolean: bool

  of NIMOBJECT_NUMBER:
      integer: int
      floating: float

  of NIMOBJECT_STRING:
      str: string

  of NIMOBJECT_ARRAY:
      arr: seq[NimRef]

  of NIMOBJECT_OBJECT:
      dict: seq[tuple[key, value: NimRef]]

  of NIMOBJECT_TYPE:
      name: string
      attrs: seq[tuple[name: string, value: NimRef]]

  else:
      nil

  
NimRef = ref NimObj

proc nimobj(val: seq[tuple[key, value: NimRef]]): NimRef {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Creates a new dictionary of Nim objects. Note: keys is a Nim objects. 
proc nimtype(name: string = "NimType"): NimRef {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Creates a new Nim type.

Converts the Nim object to its string representation.

proc `==`(a, b: NimRef): bool {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Compares two Nim objects. 
proc `+`(a, b: NimRef): NimRef {...}{.raises: [ValueError], tags: [].}
Adds two Nim objects.

Examples:

var
  anum = nimobj(5)
  bnum = nimobj(5)
  astr = nimobj("5")
  bstr = nimobj("5")
  aarr = nimobj(@[nimobj(5)])
  barr = nimobj(@[nimobj(5)])
assert anum + bnum == nimobj(10)
assert astr + bstr == nimobj("55")
assert aarr + barr == nimobj(@[nimobj(5), nimobj(5)])

Macros

macro tonimobj(a: untyped): untyped
macro `->`(a: NimRef; attr: untyped): untyped
This uses in the nim object types.

Example

var mytype = nimtype("MyType")
mytype.setAttr(test, 123)
echo mytype->test
macro setAttr(a: NimRef; attr, value: untyped): untyped
This uses in the nim object types.

Example

var mytype = nimtype("MyType")
mytype.setAttr(test, 123)
macro class(a, b: untyped): untyped
Creates a new NimObject Type.

Example

class A:
  test = 1
  a = "smth here"
  b = @[1, 0.1, false, "..."]
echo A->b
